channel.title: Prototype Pooeybum [Runesource]
channel.description:
Hello, this is the first release of Project Pooeybum ([url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,541440.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,541440.0.html[/url])
This is a server base I designed specifically for [b][u]you[/u][/b]. I have tried to make it as a desirable as possible while still leaving plenty for you to do. Essentially, I am continuing Blakeman's dream in the hope that you will use this (Runesource - [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,462049.msg3380039.html#msg3380039]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,462049.msg3380039.html#msg3380039[/url]) over other basses.
For additional features I used Azure as the original base and worked off of that.
Features:
Special Attack system (Only Dragon Dagger and whip so far) Fully working magic system with all combat spells added (Utilising - [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,489404.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,489404.0.html[/url]) All combat is entity based and I tried to annotate it as much as possible for your convenience. Ranging works, including most thrown weapons (Still needs knives added - Will be fairly easy to add in once you work out how) Many bugs from both Azure and the original Runesource fixed Npc following (Not clipped) Poisoning System (Works for every weapon with a '(p)', '(p+)' or '(p++)' including the right level of poison and the time it takes to wear off) Player vs Player has not been tested enough yet but the formulas are all the ones I found on the internet saying they were the real Runescape ones :) (As NPC vs Player works I don't see why PVP wouldn't) Area affect spells all work Item bonuses loaded via XML file (Not all are added yet but the server will tell you if an item with no bonuses is equipped) Prayer works but the head icons do not show. Also has all the features of Azure Fully working special bars (the correct way to improve bandwidth use when hosting) All Ancient Magics work but some still haven't been added to the autocasting list (You can work out how to add them (They will all be added in the next Prototype))
tl;dr this is the ideal base for someone who can't be assed writing the combat system but wants to do everything else themself.
Here is a video of the combat (Not quite up to date but shows off the important bits): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5f_6njV_I7A
Just because it is awesome: [img]http://oi42.tinypic.com/1sijkj.jpg[/img]
Make sure you read the features as well as some of the more recent additions are not in the video.
Note to readers: Please feel free to lend your suggestions here or on the project thread. This is merely the first release in the hope that you fellas will contribute things you would like to see in the next prototype. (Remember that I would like to leave as much for you guys to do as possible without making it seem too daunting for you to even start)
Credits: blakeman8192 Primadude BFMV The Moparscape and Rune-S3rv3r community (Although those guys are mainly pretentious dickheads)
Note about server not working: 1. If you get an error with the words xstream and then huge amounts of error you need to update your version of JDK to the latest. 2. This base must be loaded using an IDE with the arguments: "localhost 43594 600" (No '""' and in Program arguments). I recommend Eclipse. 3. The only client I have got to work is Galkon's Enhanced V3.1 (Even V3.2 wont work) I have absolutely no idea why and it is a source of much frustration for me.
[u][b]And here is the download link!:[/b][/u] [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?bpwqzr5bhv9drbj]http://www.mediafire.com/?bpwqzr5bhv9drbj[/url]
This is a link I found for Galkon's Enhanced V3.1 (Credits to Galkon for the client) [url=http://www.cache.fatalanarchy.net/Galkons%20Enhanced%20V3.1.zip]http://www.cache.fatalanarchy.net/Galkons%20Enhanced%20V3.1.zip[/url]
Oh, and I am also Tatemo but I was locked out of my account at some point and have only just regained access to it so I am using this account for this Project :)

item.description:

People should attempt to use this!
[/quote]

My attempt at using it is proving to be a little bit of a flop. I don’t think I could ever finish a project. I have just realised that Project Stinky-Arse will be pretty much unplayable. (No one can be bothered to follow a quest progression on a Runescape style system.)[/quote]

You should continue this, man!

item.description:

People should attempt to use this!
[/quote]

My attempt at using it is proving to be a little bit of a flop. I don’t think I could ever finish a project. I have just realised that Project Stinky-Arse will be pretty much unplayable. (No one can be bothered to follow a quest progression on a Runescape style system.)[/quote]
Atleast your trying? No one ever clearly stated you had to go above and beyond. People do not really like change :.

I found a couple more bugs:

You gain experience and constantly level when your hp is 99.
When you level your health goes to the new level (fully healed).

I would be more satisfied if someone tried to actually make this server host able and actually got a good player-base using a server based on RuneSource whether it be this or the base itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Prototype Pooeybum [Runesource]
item.dc:creator: @DestriX_RS DestriX_RS
item.description:
@DestriX_RS wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:31, topic:439101”][quote author=DestriX_RS link=topic=541803.msg3982098#msg3982098 date=1335394453]

For those who decided to use this base (which is better than any Project Insanity) may or may have not noticed that you are able to kill un-attackable NPC’s (via Magic). Here is the bug fix:

In ‘Magic.java’ (com.rs2.net.packet.packets) inside the “MAGIC_ON_NPC” case put:

			if (!npc.getDefinition().isAttackable()) {
				return;
			}

under:

			Npc npc = World.getNpcs()[npcIndex];

Thank you very much for finding that glitch! I appreciate it I’ll add it to my own server I am using based off this now. If you find any more please share them.

ALSO: I will be uploading a newer version soon with this fix and a few more, I just need to finish commenting a few things (I have mainly been adding comments to what BFMV did which is now completely unintelligible in the hopes that it will make the base more user friendly)

Found another bug, trying to fix it; You can attack players outside the wilderness.
[/quote]

Go into the canAttack method in attack handler. There are some commented bits (that I did for testing) just uncomment them.[/quote]
I couldn’t find any :S

/**
 * 		
 * @author tateiscoool
 * 
 * A class handling the start of an attack
 *
 */
public class AttackHandler {

	/**
	 * The entity that is attacking
	 */
	private final Entity ATTACKER;

	/**
	 * The entity which is under attack
	 */
	private Entity victim;

	/**
	 * The timer of when the player can next hit
	 */
	private int attackTimer = -1;
	
	/**
	 * An integer holding the spell id for if the player is performing a single spell
	 */
	private int spellId = -1;
	
	/**
	 * An integer holding the spell id when a player is autocasting
	 */
	private int autocastId = -1;

	/**
	 * A list containing the entity's current
	 * pending hits
	 */
	public LinkedList<Hit> Hits = new LinkedList<Hit>(); 
	
	/**
	 * Handles the special attack class for each player
	 */
	private SpecialAttack specialAttack;
	
	/**
	 * Contains whether the special button has been clicked or not
	 */
	private boolean specialClicked = false;

	/**
	 * Gets the attack class for the attack style
	 * @return the attack class
	 */
	private Attack attack() {
		ATTACKER.setAttackType(getAttackType());
		if (ATTACKER.getAttackType() == AttackTypes.MELEE) {
			return new MeleeAttack(ATTACKER, victim);
		} else if (ATTACKER.getAttackType() == AttackTypes.RANGE) {
			return new RangeAttack(ATTACKER, victim);
		} else if (ATTACKER.getAttackType() == AttackTypes.MAGIC) {
			return new MagicAttack(ATTACKER, victim);
		} else {
			return null;
		}
	}

	/**
	 * Sets the attack type the entity is using
	 */
	private AttackTypes getAttackType() {
		if (getSpellId() != -1 || getAutocastId() != -1)
			return AttackTypes.MAGIC;
		else if (ATTACKER instanceof Player) {
			Player player = (Player) ATTACKER;
			if (player.getEquipment().getItemContainer().get(Constants.EQUIPMENT_SLOT_WEAPON) != null) {
				if (Equipment.isRanged(player.getEquipment().getItemContainer().get(Constants.EQUIPMENT_SLOT_WEAPON).getId()))
					return AttackTypes.RANGE;
			}
		} 
		return AttackTypes.MELEE;
	}

	/**
	 * Initiates the class
	 * @param entity the attacker
	 */
	public AttackHandler(Entity entity) {
		ATTACKER = entity;
		if (entity instanceof Player)
			specialAttack = new SpecialAttack((Player)entity);
	}


	/**
	 * This method starts the attack between the attacker
	 * and the victim.
	 * It is used to run all the checks that must be run before
	 * any type of combat can be initiated. E.g. that the attack
	 * timer has run down.
	 * 
	 * @param attackType The way in which the attacker called this method
	 * @param victim The /possible/ victim of the attack (Checks if possible first)
	 */
	public void startAttack(AttackType attackType, Entity victim, int spellId) {
		if (getAutocastId() != -1)
			setSpellId(getAutocastId());
		setSpellId(spellId);
		if (attackTimer > 0 || !canAttack(victim)) {
			return;
		}
		ATTACKER.turnTo(victim);
		this.victim = victim;
		if (specialClicked && getSpellId() == -1) {
			getSpecialAttack().doSpecialAttack(victim);
			return;
		}
		attack().startAttack();
	}

	public void attackProcess() {
		attackTimer--;
		if (victim != null)
			if (victim.isDead())
				victim = null;
		if (victim instanceof Player)
			if (((Player) victim).getLoginStage() == LoginStages.LOGGED_OUT)
				victim = null;
		if (attackTimer <= 0 && victim != null) {
			startAttack(AttackType.CONTINUED_ATTACK, victim, -1);
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Hits.size(); i++) {
			Hits.get(i).decreaseHitTimer();
			if (Hits.get(i).getNeedsRemoval()) {
				if (ATTACKER instanceof Player)
					attack().addExp(((Player) ATTACKER), Hits.get(i).getDamage());
				Hits.get(i).getVictim().getAttackHandler().setVictim(ATTACKER);
				Hits.remove(i);
			}
		}
	}

	/**
	 * A method which resets the attack
	 * of an entity. To be used when the
	 * attacker dies.
	 */
	public void resetAttackOnDeath() {
		Hits.clear();
		victim = null;
		attackTimer = -1;
	}

	/**
	 * Resets attack for when the attacker moves
	 */
	public void resetAttackOnMove() {
		victim = null;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets the attack timer
	 * @param time the attacktimer
	 */
	public void setAttackTimer(int time) {
		attackTimer = time;
	}
	
	/**
	 * @return the attackTimer
	 */
	
	public int getAttackTimer() {
		return attackTimer;
	}


	/**
	 * @return the spellId
	 */
	public int getSpellId() {
		return spellId;
	}
	

	/**
	 * @param spellId the spellId to set
	 */
	public void setSpellId(int spellId) {
		this.spellId = spellId;
	}
	
	/**
	 * @return the autocastid
	 */
	public int getAutocastId() {
		return autocastId;
	}
	
	/**
	 * @param autocastId the autocastid to set
	 */
	public void setAutocastId(int autocastId) {
		this.autocastId = autocastId;
	}

	/**
	 * Changes the target a player is attacking
	 * @param entity the new victim
	 */
	public void setVictim(Entity entity) {
		this.victim = entity;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Sets a spell to autocast
	 * @param buttonId The button pressed
	 */
	public boolean setAutocast(int buttonId) {
		if (ATTACKER instanceof Npc)
			return false;
		Player player = (Player) ATTACKER;
		for (int i = 0; i < player.getCombatUtils().autocastButtons.length; i++) {
			if (player.getCombatUtils().autocastButtons[i][0] == buttonId) {
				this.autocastId = (player.getCombatUtils().autocastButtons[i][1]);
				return true;
			}
		}
		return false;
	}

	/**
	 * An enum containing all the possible ways the main
	 * method of this class can be used from.
	 */
	public static enum AttackType {
		MAGIC_ON_NPC,
		MAGIC_ON_PLAYER,
		ATTACK_PLAYER,
		ATTACK_NPC,
		CONTINUED_ATTACK,
		RETALIATION;
	}

	/**
	 * Adds a hit.
	 * @param attackTypes What attack type is being used
	 * and therefore which max hit needs to be fetched.
	 */
	public void addHit(Entity victim, AttackTypes attackType, int endGfx, int movementDelay, int specialDamage) {
		int nextDamage = 0;
		boolean attackHits = true;
		if (ATTACKER instanceof Player) {
			Player attackingPlayer = (Player) ATTACKER;
			if (victim instanceof Player) {
				Player victimPlayer = (Player) victim;
				int attackerChance = attackingPlayer.getCombatUtils().getHitChance();
				int victimDefence = victimPlayer.getCombatUtils().getDefence(attackingPlayer.getAttackStyle());
				if (attackerChance <= victimDefence) {
					if (new SecureRandom().nextInt(100) <= (double)((double) (attackerChance - 1) / (2 * victimDefence)) * 100) {
						attackHits = true;
					} else {
						attackHits = false;
					}
				} else if (attackerChance > victimDefence) {
					if (new SecureRandom().nextInt(100) <= (double) (1 - ( (double) (victimDefence + 1) / (2 * attackerChance))) * 100) {
						attackHits = true;
					} else {
						attackHits = false;
					}
				}
			}
			if (attackHits && attack().getMaxHit() != -1) {
				nextDamage = new SecureRandom().nextInt(attack().getMaxHit() + 1);
			} else
				nextDamage = 0;
		} else if (ATTACKER instanceof Npc && attack().getMaxHit() != -1) {
			nextDamage = new SecureRandom().nextInt(attack().getMaxHit());
		}
		if (attack().getMaxHit() == -1)
			nextDamage = -1;
		if (attackType != AttackTypes.MAGIC && attackType != AttackTypes.RANGE && attackType != AttackTypes.SPECIAL)
			Hits.add(new Hit(victim, nextDamage, ATTACKER.grabHitTimer(), attackType, endGfx, movementDelay));
		else if (attackType == AttackTypes.SPECIAL)
			Hits.add(new Hit(victim, specialDamage, ATTACKER.grabHitTimer(), attackType, endGfx, movementDelay));
		else
			Hits.add(new Hit(victim, nextDamage, ATTACKER.grabProjectileHitTimer(ATTACKER.getPosition(), victim.getPosition()), attackType, endGfx, movementDelay));
		if (attackType != AttackTypes.MAGIC) {
			if (new SecureRandom().nextInt(100) <= 20) {
				if (ATTACKER instanceof Player) {
					if (WeaponInfo.checkWeaponForPoison(((Player)ATTACKER).getEquipment().getItemContainer().get(Constants.EQUIPMENT_SLOT_WEAPON)))
						victim.applyPoison(WeaponInfo.getPoisonDamageForWeapon(((Player)ATTACKER).getEquipment().getItemContainer().get(Constants.EQUIPMENT_SLOT_WEAPON)));
				}
			}
		}
	}

	/**
	 * Gets the victim
	 */
	public Entity getVictimEntity() {
		return victim;
	}

	/**
	 * Checks if the attacker can attack the victim
	 * @param victim the victim
	 */
	public boolean canAttack(Entity victim) {
		if ((ATTACKER == null) || (victim == null)) {
			return false;
		}
		if ((ATTACKER.isDead()) || (victim.isDead())) {
			return false;
		}
		if ((ATTACKER instanceof Player) && (victim instanceof Player)) {
			if (!Areas.isInWildernessArea(victim.getPosition())) {
				Player player = (Player) ATTACKER;
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("That player is not in the wilderness.");
				return false;
			}
			if (!Areas.isInWildernessArea(ATTACKER.getPosition())) {
				Player player = (Player) ATTACKER;
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You are not in the wilderness.");
				return false;
			}
		}
		if (victim.getAttackHandler().getVictimEntity() != ATTACKER && victim.getAttackHandler().getVictimEntity() != null && !Areas.isInMultiArea(victim.getPosition())) {
			if (ATTACKER instanceof Player) {
				Player player = (Player) ATTACKER;
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your target is already in combat.");
			}
			return false;
		}
		if (Misc.getDistance(ATTACKER.getPosition(), victim.getPosition()) == 0) {
			//TODO: Make this do something
			return false;
		}
		if (!distanceCheck(victim)) {
			ATTACKER.setFollowingCombat(victim);
			return false;
		}
		return true;
	}

	/**
	 * Checks the distance between the entity and attacker
	 * @return
	 */
	private boolean distanceCheck(Entity victim) {
		if (getAttackType() == AttackTypes.RANGE) {
			if (Misc.getDistance(ATTACKER.getPosition(), victim.getPosition()) <= 7) {
				if (ATTACKER instanceof Player)
					((Player) ATTACKER).getMovementHandler().reset();
				else if (ATTACKER instanceof Npc)
					((Npc) ATTACKER).getNpcMovement().reset();
				return true;
			}
		} else if (getAttackType() == AttackTypes.MAGIC) {
			if (Misc.getDistance(ATTACKER.getPosition(), victim.getPosition()) <= 7) {
				if (ATTACKER instanceof Player)
					((Player) ATTACKER).getMovementHandler().reset();
				else if (ATTACKER instanceof Npc)
					((Npc) ATTACKER).getNpcMovement().reset();
				return true;
			}
		} else if (getAttackType() == AttackTypes.MELEE) {
			if (Misc.getDistance(ATTACKER.getPosition(), victim.getPosition()) == 1) {
				return true;
			}
		}
		return false;
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Prototype Pooeybum [Runesource]
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“DestriX_RS, post:30, topic:439101”][quote author=BorigTheDwarf link=topic=541803.msg3981628#msg3981628 date=1335332810]

For those who decided to use this base (which is better than any Project Insanity) may or may have not noticed that you are able to kill un-attackable NPC’s (via Magic). Here is the bug fix:

In ‘Magic.java’ (com.rs2.net.packet.packets) inside the “MAGIC_ON_NPC” case put:

			if (!npc.getDefinition().isAttackable()) {
				return;
			}

under:

			Npc npc = World.getNpcs()[npcIndex];

Thank you very much for finding that glitch! I appreciate it I’ll add it to my own server I am using based off this now. If you find any more please share them.

ALSO: I will be uploading a newer version soon with this fix and a few more, I just need to finish commenting a few things (I have mainly been adding comments to what BFMV did which is now completely unintelligible in the hopes that it will make the base more user friendly)
[/quote]

Found another bug, trying to fix it; You can attack players outside the wilderness.[/quote]

Go into the canAttack method in attack handler. There are some commented bits (that I did for testing) just uncomment them.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @DestriX_RS DestriX_RS
item.description:
@DestriX_RS wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:28, topic:439101”][quote author=DestriX_RS link=topic=541803.msg3981460#msg3981460 date=1335313862]
For those who decided to use this base (which is better than any Project Insanity) may or may have not noticed that you are able to kill un-attackable NPC’s (via Magic). Here is the bug fix:

In ‘Magic.java’ (com.rs2.net.packet.packets) inside the “MAGIC_ON_NPC” case put:

			if (!npc.getDefinition().isAttackable()) {
				return;
			}

under:

			Npc npc = World.getNpcs()[npcIndex];

[/quote]

Thank you very much for finding that glitch! I appreciate it I’ll add it to my own server I am using based off this now. If you find any more please share them.

ALSO: I will be uploading a newer version soon with this fix and a few more, I just need to finish commenting a few things (I have mainly been adding comments to what BFMV did which is now completely unintelligible in the hopes that it will make the base more user friendly)[/quote]

item.title: Prototype Pooeybum [Runesource]
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“DestriX_RS, post:27, topic:439101”]For those who decided to use this base (which is better than any Project Insanity) may or may have not noticed that you are able to kill un-attackable NPC’s (via Magic). Here is the bug fix:

In ‘Magic.java’ (com.rs2.net.packet.packets) inside the “MAGIC_ON_NPC” case put:

			if (!npc.getDefinition().isAttackable()) {
				return;
			}

under:

Npc npc = World.getNpcs()[npcIndex]; [/quote]

Thank you very much for finding that glitch! I appreciate it I’ll add it to my own server I am using based off this now. If you find any more please share them.

ALSO: I will be uploading a newer version soon with this fix and a few more, I just need to finish commenting a few things (I have mainly been adding comments to what BFMV did which is now completely unintelligible in the hopes that it will make the base more user friendly)

Read full topic

item.title: Prototype Pooeybum [Runesource]
item.dc:creator: @DestriX_RS DestriX_RS
item.description:
@DestriX_RS wrote:

For those who decided to use this base (which is better than any Project Insanity) may or may have not noticed that you are able to kill un-attackable NPC’s (via Magic). Here is the bug fix:

In ‘Magic.java’ (com.rs2.net.packet.packets) inside the “MAGIC_ON_NPC” case put:

			if (!npc.getDefinition().isAttackable()) {
				return;
			}

under:

			Npc npc = World.getNpcs()[npcIndex];

Read full topic

item.title: Prototype Pooeybum [Runesource]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:20, topic:439101”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=541803.msg3969338#msg3969338 date=1334014844]

Very good decision. Is there anything else you think I should add?

Clipped npc/player following & pathfinding of course

Player following is already clipped using the client sided following methods. I tried adding clipped npc following but it was so buggy and resource raping that I thought it was better without. It doesn’t really matter anyway as you can still do safing (pretty much the only use of npc clipped following) by standing 2 squares outside of their walk back range so they keep walking towards you and then back to their starting spot.

Autocasting is done. 100% all combat spells. (Simply a matter of adding the ids in CombatUtils.java)

Prayer headicons are a client sided issue they work server sided. Last time I tried messing with the client everything blew up.

oh nice, well if you find out how to fix the headicons, hit me up in PM

Look on Rune-S3rv3r for one of 3000 tutorials on how to hardcode head icons. If you hope to create your own server you have to be able to do some things on your own as well

I have a development thread on the first page, check it out i’m not a noob lol
I just never did something client sided since i prefer a good old unedited 317-377
i’ll look up some tutorials
[/quote]

But how can you have an unedited 317-377 that can also load headicons? Last I heard no one knew how to load them from the cache.

EDIT: Just looked at some of your tuts. Pretty sweet work dude, I apologise for implying you didn’t know what you were doing. My client abilities are also sadly lacking. You definitely need to put your talents to use on things other than Delta. :)[/quote]

  • unnedited I actually meant, that I do not add anything like models and stuff. I never touch my client.
    also spadesscape’s 317 and 377 client loads everything via the cache

  • thanks

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:19, topic:439101”][quote author=BorigTheDwarf link=topic=541803.msg3969329#msg3969329 date=1334014536]

Very good decision. Is there anything else you think I should add?

Clipped npc/player following & pathfinding of course

Player following is already clipped using the client sided following methods. I tried adding clipped npc following but it was so buggy and resource raping that I thought it was better without. It doesn’t really matter anyway as you can still do safing (pretty much the only use of npc clipped following) by standing 2 squares outside of their walk back range so they keep walking towards you and then back to their starting spot.

Autocasting is done. 100% all combat spells. (Simply a matter of adding the ids in CombatUtils.java)

Prayer headicons are a client sided issue they work server sided. Last time I tried messing with the client everything blew up.

oh nice, well if you find out how to fix the headicons, hit me up in PM

Look on Rune-S3rv3r for one of 3000 tutorials on how to hardcode head icons. If you hope to create your own server you have to be able to do some things on your own as well
[/quote]

I have a development thread on the first page, check it out i’m not a noob lol
I just never did something client sided since i prefer a good old unedited 317-377
i’ll look up some tutorials[/quote]

But how can you have an unedited 317-377 that can also load headicons? Last I heard no one knew how to load them from the cache.

EDIT: Just looked at some of your tuts. Pretty sweet work dude, I apologise for implying you didn’t know what you were doing. My client abilities are also sadly lacking. You definitely need to put your talents to use on things other than Delta.
